law.catch_line: Board's disciplinary powers -- Reasons for sanctions -- Appeal to Franklin Circuit Court.

text.section: When the board issues a written reprimand to the licensee, a copy of the reprimand shall be placed in the permanent file of the licensee. The licensee shall have the right to submit a response within thirty (30) days of its receipt and to have that response filed in the permanent file.
At any time during the investigative or hearing processes, the board may accept an assurance of voluntary compliance from the licensee which effectively deals with the complaint.
The board may reconsider, modify, or reverse its probation, suspensions, or other disciplinary action.

Five (5) years from the date of a revocation, any person whose license has been revoked may petition the board for reinstatement. The board shall investigate the petition and may reinstate the license upon a finding that the individual has complied with any terms prescribed by the board and is again able to competently engage in the practice of interpreting.
Any party aggrieved by a disciplinary action of the board may bring an action in Franklin Circuit Court in accordance with the provisions of KRS Chapter 13B.

law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 11, sec. 11, effective July 15, 1998.
